Mike Senin

Saratov · Russia · msenin.work@gmail.com

Hi! I'm a DevOps and QA enthusiast with 8.5+ years of wide experience in cloud and on-premise technologies.
Designed, automated, and tested highly loaded production systems for telco, e-commerce, and fintech companies.
Organized and led distributed international teams (3-7 engineers) as DevOps and QA lead.
Experienced with k8s, GCP, OpenStack, OpenShift platforms.

Experience

Software Engineer 4

Juniper Networks

Juniper Networks acquired Apstra startup, where I was working, and I got the offer to join the team as part of the Juniper Apstra department. I was in charge of on-prem k8s, Jenkins, DevSecOps practices, internal frameworks, and tooling for the Juniper Apstra product.

  • Improved the availability of the on-prem k8s cluster using monitoring/alerting system statistics, implementing smoke tests and server tuning
  • Leveraged all benefits from DevSecOps OWASP tools and integrated them into CI pipelines
  • Dramatically optimized k8s build servers utilization using custom schedulers
  • Integrated and configured ELK stack for k8s cluster and for build infrastructure components
  • Documented cookbooks for Ops engineers

    • Technologies: K8S, TektonPipelines, Kapitan, Kubespray, Python, Helm, Ansible, Packer, Jenkins, JobDSL, OWASP tools, SonarQube, Minio, DistCC, Groovy, Snyk.io, ELK, distcc

    September 2018 - May 2019

    Lead DevOps Engineer

    Grid Dynamics

    I grew up to Lead Engineer after half a year at Kohl's Merchandising project. Our main goal was to migrate applications from mainframes and adapt them to the OpenShift platform.
    I built the DevOps team from scratch (up to 5 people), design and set up CI/CD and release management processes, migrated applications from mainframes to the cloud.
    During on-site consulting sessions, I was at the edge. I collected business requirements from the customer and converted them to tech tasks, redesigned old services, and made HA and DR (Disaster recovery) architecture proposals.
    As a result of my work the builds and deployment time execution reduced to x3 times, reduced count of jobs, and optimized Jenkins usage.
    Grafana/InfluxDB/Prometheus monitoring solution was successfully demonstrated to the customer (Merch/Marketing/OCF) and partially used by some of the teams to eliminate costs on existent monitoring solution.

    Lead QA Engineer

    Mirantis
